question:
Benjamin drives for 11 hours at a speed of 44 mph and then turns around because he realizes he forgot something very important at home.
    He tries to get home in 7 hours but spends the first 3 hours in standstill traffic.
    He spends the next 2 driving at a speed of 72mph, before being able to drive the remaining time of the 7 hours going at 24 mph.
    How far is he from home at the end of those 7 hours?
answer:
When he turned around he was 11*44=<<11*44=484>>484 miles from home.
    He was only able to drive 7-3=<<7-3=4>>4 hours in the first 7 hours.
    In 2 hour he goes 72*2=<<72*2=144>>144 miles.
    He then drives another 4-2=<<4-2=2>>2 hours.
    In that time he goes 24*2=<<24*2=48>>48 miles.
    So he drove 48+144=<<48+144=192>>192 miles.
    So he is 484-192=<<484-192=292>>292 miles away from home.
    #### 292

Isaac drives for 47 hours at a speed of 50 mph and then turns around because he realizes he forgot something very important at home.
    He tries to get home in 47 hours but spends the first 24 hours in standstill traffic.
    He spends the next 9 driving at a speed of 109mph, before being able to drive the remaining time of the 47 hours going at 63 mph.
    How far is he from home at the end of those 47 hours?
answer:
When he turned around he was 47*50=<<47*50=2350>>2350 miles from home.
    He was only able to drive 47-24=<<47-24=23>>23 hours in the first 47 hours.
    In 9 hour he goes 109*9=<<109*9=981>>981 miles.
    He then drives another 23-9=<<23-9=14>>14 hours.
    In that time he goes 63*14=<<63*14=882>>882 miles.
    So he drove 882+981=<<882+981=1863>>1863 miles.
    So he is 2350-1863=<<2350-1863=487>>487 miles away from home.
    #### 487
